title: YARD / HANGED MAN
description: A corpse hangs from the pine-tree: a middle aged man in white armour boots and tighty whities. A medium PERCEPTION white-check lets you find a bullet hole in the back of his mouth, a low LOGIC white check that he was killed before hanging. A low THOUGHT CABINET w-c sees that the bullet is antique.

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We have a make and a number -- tha..."
dialogueTree.text: "We have a make and a number -- that's something. We can use the radio in my Kineema when we're done. Either station can chase it for us."

links.title: You: ""What happened to the rest of it?""
links.text: "What happened to the rest of it?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He nods: "Piece by piece. He's been..."
links.text: He nods: "Piece by piece. He's been out here for seven days -- it would be odd if they didn't."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We should keep a lookout for these..."
links.text: "We should keep a lookout for these pieces. The armour could yield information." He nods toward the red-haired boy eyeing you suspiciously. "This is one thing he might actually know..."

links.title: Pain Threshold: "If you wear those pieces, it will h..."
links.text: If you wear those pieces, it will help me protect your mortal coil.

links.title: You: "Why, does my mortal coil need prote..."
links.text: Why, does my mortal coil need protecting?

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Yes. Bullets will fly, they always..."
links.text: Yes. Bullets will fly, they always do. And the coil is fleshy and mush and permeable. Cast it in ceramic shell. Resist death.

links.title: Endurance: "I'm not squishy and permeable. I'm..."
links.text: I'm not squishy and permeable. I'm bark, sap and steel. Cast me in ceramic shell, but only for *ritual purposes*. It would adorn me well... bring me to attention.

links.title: You: ""Maybe he was just wearing these bo..."
links.text: "Maybe he was just wearing these boots and there is no rest of the armour?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No, I think he had something preci..."
links.text: "No, I think he had something precious underneath his clothes. They had to remove the *jeans* we found in the trash to get to it. This kind of armour is often worn *under* fabric."

links.title: Logic: "Nice. That makes sense."
links.text: Nice. That makes sense.

links.title: You: ""He could have been walking around..."
links.text: "He could have been walking around naked -- just like this for all we know."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A good point. He could have been i..."
links.text: "A good point. He could have been intoxicated. Or something we cannot yet imagine... I shouldn't have assumed so much just from the clothes."

links.title: Empathy: "What was that? Was the lieutenant j..."
links.text: What was that? Was the lieutenant just impressed by your unintuitive guess?

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "He was. Why else would he call it a..."
links.text: He was. Why else would he call it a very good point? Does this mean you're a *very* good detective? Possibly.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No. He must have worn something pr..."
links.text: "No. He must have worn something precious underneath his clothes. They've removed all his clothes to get to it -- they did not just strip him for the putrid rags."

links.title: You: ""Then where are these clothes -- ha..."
links.text: "Then where are these clothes -- have you seen any around?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Someone could have cleaned the yar..."
links.text: "Someone could have cleaned the yard. But that's a question for... the red-haired thing."

links.title: Cuno: ""I hear you, f****t cop. Talking sh..."
links.text: "I hear you, f****t cop. Talking shit 'bout the Cuno. Come here and say it to Cuno's face!"

links.title: You: ""Fuck you, Cuno!""
links.text: "Fuck you, Cuno!"

links.title: Cuno: ""You wanna fuck me, huh? You wanna..."
links.text: "You wanna fuck me, huh? You wanna FUCK the Cuno?"

links.title: Volition: "Ignore. Say no more. This is about..."
links.text: Ignore. Say no more. This is about the corpse and inspecting it.

links.title: Cuno: ""I hear you, f****t! Talking shit '..."
links.text: "I hear you, f****t! Talking shit 'bout the Cuno. Come here and say it to Cuno's face!" the boy shrieks at the top of his lungs.

links.title: You: ""What if they told him to strip bef..."
links.text: "What if they told him to strip before they hung him? To demean him?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""*They* usually hang them completel..."
links.text: "*They* usually hang them completely naked for that. La Puta Madre, the Mazda, the Besmerties, and the like. This one still has his underpants."

links.title: Cuno: ""What are you tryin'a ignore me now..."
links.text: "What are you tryin'a ignore me now, fuck face?"

links.title: Cunoesse: ""Cuno this boot-shit is super borin..."
links.text: "Cuno this boot-shit is super boring and the guys are total *vittupää's*."

links.title: Cuno: ""Fucking talkin' about underpants...""
links.text: "Fucking talkin' about underpants..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Clearly Cuno would like to interjec..."
links.text: Clearly Cuno would like to interject something here, but there's not enough for him to hold on to.

links.title: You: ""Understood.""
links.text: "Understood."

links.title: The Hanged Man: "The sabatons dangle off the man's d..."
links.text: The sabatons dangle off the man's decaying form, ageless and synthetic.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We should keep a lookout for these..."
links.text: "We should keep a lookout for these pieces. The armour could yield information." He nods toward the red-haired boy eyeing you suspiciously. "Maybe he'll know something."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The locals probably scavenged it -..."
links.text: "The locals probably scavenged it -- it would be odd if he had more on after *seven* days."

links.title: You: ""The material looks out of place he..."
links.text: "The material looks out of place here."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It is. It's expensive." The lieute..."
links.text: "It is. It's expensive." The lieutenant draws a line in the condensation on the ceramic -- with his index finger.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We've requested similar material f..."
links.text: "We've requested similar material for our tactical units for years now. The Constabulary's deemed it too costly. In that time, we've lost six men to semi-automatics."

links.title: You: ""How much are we talking about?""
links.text: "How much are we talking about?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""For a full set -- about four years..."
links.text: "For a full set -- about four years of wages."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "For the Northwest Region of Revacho..."
links.text: For the Northwest Region of Revachol, an officer's average yearly income is 5,500 reál (unadjusted for rank).

links.title: You: ""Wait -- my yearly pay is 5,500 reá..."
links.text: "Wait -- my yearly pay is 5,500 reál?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Not too much, yes.""
links.text: "Not too much, yes."

links.title: You: ""It's enough.""
links.text: "It's enough."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant nods, wiping his fin..."
links.text: The lieutenant nods, wiping his finger on his sleeve.

links.title: You: ""Pathetic. I need to hustle more an..."
links.text: "Pathetic. I need to hustle more and hate less."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I have no idea what that means.""
links.text: "I have no idea what that means."

links.title: You: ""Sounds puny. No wonder I can't pay..."
links.text: "Sounds puny. No wonder I can't pay my hostel bill."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's a sorry situation, I agree.""
links.text: "It's a sorry situation, I agree."

links.title: You: ""Ka-ching, baby!" (Nod to the boots..."
links.text: "Ka-ching, baby!" (Nod to the boots.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""By *ka-ching* do you mean..." He t..."
links.text: "By *ka-ching* do you mean..." He tilts his head. "'Let's not log them as evidence, let's steal them'?"

links.title: Suggestion: "What was that about the Constabulat..."
links.text: What was that about the Constabulatory before? You need to push some buttons if you want to recruit the lieutenant in a conspiracy.

links.title: You: ""No. That's not what I meant.""
links.text: "No. That's not what I meant."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Of course." He nods."
links.text: "Of course." He nods.

links.title: Composure: "The lieutenant nods often. It's par..."
links.text: The lieutenant nods often. It's part of his un-plastic expression range, communicating both professionalism and sarcasm. This time, the latter.

links.title: You: ""That *is* what ka-ching means, yes.""
links.text: "That *is* what ka-ching means, yes."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Mhm. It means 'disciplinary hearin..."
links.text: "Mhm. It means 'disciplinary hearing'." The lieutenant nods, wiping his finger on his sleeve.

links.title: You: ""If this *Constabulatory* is draggi..."
links.text: "If this *Constabulatory* is dragging their feet why not start ourselves, before more good men die?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""So they don't get shot in the foot..."
links.text: "So they don't get shot in the foot? I think our *extremities* are fine without a dead man's boots."

links.title: You: ""Uhm...""
Suggestion: "Oops. Well, no one said it would wo..."
links.text: Oops. Well, no one said it would work. Back to detecting now.

links.title: You: ""Yeah.""
links.text: "Yeah."

links.title: You: ""That's a lot, I take it?""
links.text: "That's a lot, I take it?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""As a wage, it's regrettably small...."
links.text: "As a wage, it's regrettably small. But for a piece of hardware -- yes, that's a lot."

links.title: You: ""How could this man afford such exp..."
links.text: "How could this man afford such expensive hardware?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""He worked for Krenel -- like Joyce..."
links.text: "He worked for Krenel -- like Joyce told us. This is military equipment, provided by a wealthy security contractor. With state ties. *Way* above what we have."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Looks like he worked for a private..."
links.text: "Looks like he worked for a private contractor -- like Evrart told us. Wealthy. With state ties. This is *way* above what we have."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's for us to find out." He che..."
links.text: "That's for us to find out." He checks his notes. "Mr... Garte implied he was security personnel for the harbour company. This confirms my own assumptions."

links.title: You: ""Initial report?""
links.text: "Initial report?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Just something I scraped together..."
links.text: "Just something I scraped together from my station. An area report on Martinaise. I'm sure you did the same..."

links.title: Empathy: "He's not actually sure of that. He'..."
links.text: He's not actually sure of that. He's just being tactful.

links.title: You: ""These look pretty advanced for a s..."
links.text: "These look pretty advanced for a security guard."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I agree. This equipment is *way* b..."
links.text: "I agree. This equipment is *way* beyond what a guard can afford."

links.title: You: ""Okay. Makes sense.""
links.text: "Okay. Makes sense."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No." He shakes his head. "Your fir..."
links.text: "No." He shakes his head. "Your first instinct was correct. This equipment is way beyond what a security guard can afford."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's for us to find out. My init..."
links.text: "That's for us to find out. My initial report on the area suggests he was a security guard for the harbour company -- but that's just hearsay."

links.title: You: "Knock on the boot."
links.text: Knock on the boot.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "A small bell-like sound fills the a..."
links.text: A small bell-like sound fills the air. Like tapping on the side of a porcelain cup.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "The prybar in your hand is itching..."
links.text: The prybar in your hand is itching for some action.

links.title: You: "Swing the prybar at the boot."
links.text: Swing the prybar at the boot.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "The metal connects with the same *d..."
links.text: The metal connects with the same *ding*. The sound does not appear to get louder...

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "The only difference is a barely aud..."
links.text: The only difference is a barely audible *click* underneath. Sounds like the end of a long dice roll.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant cups his ear: "Did y..."
links.text: The lieutenant cups his ear: "Did you hear that? A click?"

links.title: You: ""What do you mean?""
links.text: "What do you mean?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This material is a kinetic re-dist..."
links.text: "This material is a kinetic re-distributor. It spreads kinetic energy horizontally. From plate to plate. When the plates connect there's a click." He points to the toe. "See these lines?"

links.title: You: ""Yes, like dice rolling.""
links.text: "Yes, like dice rolling."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This is a kinetic re-distributor...."
links.text: "This is a kinetic re-distributor. It spreads the incoming energy horizontally, from plate to plate. When the plates connect, there's a click. That's the sound you heard." He points to the toe. "See these lines?"

links.title: You: "Punch it harder."
links.text: Punch it harder.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "Your fist connects to the boot with..."
links.text: Your fist connects to the boot with the same *ding*. The sound does not appear to get louder.

links.title: You: ""Sounds fragile.""
links.text: "Sounds fragile."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's anything but. This material i..."
links.text: "It's anything but. This material is a kinetic re-distributor. It spreads kinetic energy horizontally, from plate to plate. Dissipating it entirely." He points to the boots. "See?"

links.title: The Hanged Man: "Faint, organic lines cover the plat..."
links.text: Faint, organic lines cover the plates where they separate into smaller ones. These plates then divide into smaller plates, until there are hundreds of them altogether...

links.title: Conceptualization: "...like whorls of floorboards. The..."
links.text: ...like whorls of floorboards. The design looks organic, influenced by highly resistant wood materials, like Lignum Vitae and ebony perhaps.

links.title: You: "What does this remind me of?"
links.text: What does this remind me of?

links.title: Conceptualization: "If trees were made of porcelain, th..."
links.text: If trees were made of porcelain, this is what their cross-sections would look like.

links.title: You: "Run your finger over the lines."
links.text: Run your finger over the lines.

links.title: Conceptualization: "The smooth glossy surface fractures..."
links.text: The smooth glossy surface fractures into ever more intricate interconnections, peaking on the right sabaton, where you notice...

links.title: Perception (Sight): "The whorls are in the shape of a le..."
links.text: The whorls are in the shape of a letter and number combination: E50.100.1000.

links.title: You: "(Point to it.) "Looks like there's..."
links.text: (Point to it.) "Looks like there's a serial number on the right sabaton."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good. Can you read it to me?" He t..."
links.text: "Good. Can you read it to me?" He tips the drying ball point of his pen on his tongue.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That doesn't sound like a serial n..."
links.text: "That doesn't sound like a serial number. Where's the structure and logic of a line of manufactured products..." He pauses to think. "No matter. We should run it anyway."

links.title: Logic: "True. It didn't have the cadence an..."
links.text: True. It didn't have the cadence and logic of a real manufactured item.

links.title: You: ""Yes. Let's run it as I said.""
links.text: "Yes. Let's run it as I said."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We have a make and a number -- tha..."
links.text: "We have a make and a number -- that's something. We can use the radio in my Kineema to run it later. Either station can chase it for us."

links.title: You: ""Actually, I don't know why I lied...."
links.text: "Actually, I don't know why I lied. The number is: E50.100.1000."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Officer, the decomposing corpse ha..."
links.text: "Officer, the decomposing corpse has temporarily suspended my sense of humour. Let's continue in a less playful manner." He pauses to think. "Anyway..."

links.title: You: "Not interested."
links.text: Not interested.

links.title: Conceptualization: "I am so disappointed in you. What *..."
links.text: I am so disappointed in you. What *are* you interested in, then?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Like the scales of some ancient whi..."
links.text: Like the scales of some ancient white monster, cracked and pearly.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Suddenly your biceps coil up. Your..."
links.text: Suddenly your biceps coil up. Your elbow is sharp and cocked for a punch.

links.title: You: "Pull the boot off."
links.text: Pull the boot off.

links.title: Inland Empire: "This feels... dangerous. Are you su..."
links.text: This feels... dangerous. Are you sure?

links.title: You: "Grab the boot under your arm."
links.text: Grab the boot under your arm.

links.title: You: "Better not even try."
links.text: Better not even try.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "The sabatons dangle off the man's d..."
links.text: The sabatons dangle off the man's decaying form, ageless and synthetic.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "The stench fills your nostrils. As..."
links.text: The stench fills your nostrils. As you push downward, an ominous creaking sound comes from above.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Stop!" The lieutenant's voice is s..."
links.text: "Stop!" The lieutenant's voice is sharp. He looks at you, with the boot under your arm.

links.title: Cuno: ""Pig's gonna pull his head off.""
links.text: "Pig's gonna pull his head off."

links.title: Cunoesse: ""Brutal.""
links.text: "Brutal."

links.title: You: ""What?""
links.text: "What?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Even the mongrels can see you're a..."
links.text: "Even the mongrels can see you're about to pull his head off."

links.title: Cunoesse: ""Do it, homo!""
links.text: "Do it, homo!"

links.title: You: ""I'm not a homo.""
links.text: "I'm not a homo."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Stop obsessing about your sexualit..."
links.text: "Stop obsessing about your sexuality officer, you're about to seriously compromise the coroner's case."

links.title: You: ""Do what?""
links.text: "Do what?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""*Pull his head off*. There's no po..."
links.text: "*Pull his head off*. There's no point performing an autopsy if you do, we'll have compromised the coroner's case."

links.title: You: ""I'm gonna pull his head off, right?""
links.text: "I'm gonna pull his head off, right?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, that's what I said. You'll co..."
links.text: "Yes, that's what I said. You'll compromise the coroner's case if you do. So please *don't*."

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Indeed. From this angle it does loo..."
links.text: Indeed. From this angle it does look like the neck isn't going to take much more. Being dead for a week has all but liquefied his muscles.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What are you trying to achieve any..."
links.text: "What are you trying to achieve anyway, why are you hanging on to that boot?"

links.title: You: ""These boots would go super well wi..."
links.text: "These boots would go super well with my bell-bottom pants."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You do understand the boots are st..."
links.text: "You do understand the boots are steeped in cadaverine odour, don't you?"

links.title: You: ""So are my pants.""
links.text: "So are my pants."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You have a point there, detective...."
links.text: "You have a point there, detective. You have a point. But..." The lieutenant taps on the boot.

links.title: You: ""Can't I just wash them?""
links.text: "Can't I just wash them?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You'd have to boil them in acid. B..."
links.text: "You'd have to boil them in acid. Besides..." The lieutenant taps on the boot.

links.title: You: ""You're right. I didn't think this..."
links.text: "You're right. I didn't think this through. It was an impulse thing."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There's no way you're getting them..."
links.text: "There's no way you're getting them off. All the organic matter in his body has been flowing down into the boots. They're *fused* to his feet now -- why do you think the locals haven't scavenged them yet?"

links.title: Interfacing: "There might still be a way to peel..."
links.text: There might still be a way to peel them off, but first the body needs to be down. And second -- it would probably be better if the lieutenant wasn't around...

links.title: You: "Sounds like a plan. (Accept.)"
links.text: Sounds like a plan. (Accept.)

links.title: Interfacing: "The anticipation makes you crack yo..."
links.text: The anticipation makes you crack your fingers. Feels nice. Nice and *cracky*.

links.title: You: "Steal a dead man's boots? But that..."
links.text: Steal a dead man's boots? But that would be *DISHONOURABLE*! (Refuse -- for honour.)

links.title: Interfacing: "All right then, you can pay the hos..."
links.text: All right then, you can pay the hostel bill in *honour* points. How many honour points have you collected?

links.title: You: "There are honour points?"
links.text: There are honour points?

links.title: Interfacing: "Of course there aren't, don't be na..."
links.text: Of course there aren't, don't be naive.

links.title: Inland Empire: "You still feel as though there migh..."
links.text: You still feel as though there might be some honour points. And if there are, you've surely earned one.

links.title: You: ""What's going to happen to the boot..."
links.text: "What's going to happen to the boots then?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Processing will take care of them...."
links.text: "Processing will take care of them. With the situation in the morgue, it will yield nothing. But we must pick our fights." He looks toward the boots. "Should we continue?"

links.title: You: ""Okay, got it.""
links.text: "Okay, got it."

links.title: Interfacing: "You're *sure* there's a way to peel..."
links.text: You're *sure* there's a way to peel them off -- but first the body needs to be down. And second, it would probably be better if the lieutenant wasn't around...

links.title: You: ""This is advanced enemy technology...."
links.text: "This is advanced enemy technology. We should conduct research into their weaknesses."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This is not the *enemy*, this is t..."
links.text: "This is not the *enemy*, this is the deceased. The victim. In a murder investigation."

links.title: Half Light: "Is he now? A sense of danger emanat..."
links.text: Is he now? A sense of danger emanates from the remains of the person in front of you.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "For a quarter of a second he appear..."
links.text: For a quarter of a second he appears to be looking at you. The stench of death makes your eyes well up.

links.title: You: ""I feel as though we may cross path..."
links.text: "I feel as though we may cross paths with him yet. One way or another."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""One way or *another?* I can't even..."
links.text: "One way or *another?* I can't even think of the *one* way... *magic*? *Semenese corpse salt*? Besides..." The lieutenant taps on the boot.

links.title: You: ""You're right, that makes sense.""
links.text: "You're right, that makes sense."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It *does* make sense, doesn't it?..."
links.text: "It *does* make sense, doesn't it? Besides..." The lieutenant taps on the boot.

links.title: You: ""Better safe than sorry.""
links.text: "Better safe than sorry."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That doesn't mean anything, detect..."
links.text: "That doesn't mean anything, detective. Besides..." The lieutenant taps on the boot.

links.title: You: ""Are we not detectives? There may b..."
links.text: "Are we not detectives? There may be *clues* inside the boot."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""How many clues do you need? You al..."
links.text: "How many clues do you need? You already found the number. Besides..." He taps on the boot.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Maybe we should concentrate on wha..."
links.text: "Maybe we should concentrate on what's outside the boot and leave what's inside to the boys at Processing? Just this once? Besides..." He taps on the boot.

links.title: You: ""They look fancy. I thought I could..."
links.text: "They look fancy. I thought I could pawn them, earn some *lucre*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""For a full set of armour I wouldn'..."
links.text: "For a full set of armour I wouldn't blame you. But these boots are hardly worth a disciplinary hearing. There are better ways to pay a hostel bill. Besides..." He taps the boot.

links.title: Suggestion: "It's hard to get a read on the lieu..."
links.text: It's hard to get a read on the lieutenant. What would he do if you stole them? Would he report you, or not? Surprisingly, you feel like he probably wouldn't.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Honestly -- a whole set of ceramic..."
links.text: "Honestly -- a whole set of ceramics: the breastplate, the pauldrons... I wouldn't blame you. But these two? Not worth bringing Internal Affairs into your life over. Besides..." He taps the boot.

links.title: You: ""It's that Constabulatory thing I s..."
links.text: "It's that Constabulatory thing I said before. With the dead guys. I wanna *protect* them."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay. Fine. You want to protect th..."
links.text: "Okay. Fine. You want to protect the *feet* of six dead men. That's commendable. But..." The lieutenant taps on the boot.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There's no way you're getting them..."
links.text: "There's no way you're getting them off. All the organic matter in his body has been flowing down into the boots. For *seven* days. They're *fused* to his feet now -- why do you think they're the only thing left on him?"

links.title: You: ""I'm sorry. I didn't even want to t..."
links.text: "I'm sorry. I didn't even want to take them off, I just thought I should try."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Try what exactly?""
links.text: "Try what exactly?"

links.title: Rhetoric: "If you can't experiment, how will y..."
links.text: If you can't experiment, how will you learn?

links.title: You: ""I wanted to see what happens.""
links.text: "I wanted to see what happens."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't think we should *do* anyth..."
links.text: "I don't think we should *do* anything just for the hell of it. Besides..." The lieutenant taps on the boot.

links.title: You: ""I might have wanted to experiment...."
links.text: "I might have wanted to experiment. You know, get an exploratory jive going."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I see what you mean, but even so....."
links.text: "I see what you mean, but even so..." The lieutenant taps on the boot.

links.title: You: ""I have no idea why. I just do thin..."
links.text: "I have no idea why. I just do things. There's no underlying reason."

links.title: You: ""Lieutenant, you seem distressed --..."
links.text: "Lieutenant, you seem distressed -- why?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're about to pull his head off.""
links.text: "You're about to pull his head off."

links.title: You: ""Oh! This is a bad idea, isn't it?""
links.text: "Oh! This is a bad idea, isn't it?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're going to pull his head off.""
links.text: "You're going to pull his head off."

links.title: You: "Let go of the boot."
links.text: Let go of the boot.

links.title: Cunoesse: ""What's wrong with you, asshole? Wh..."
links.text: "What's wrong with you, asshole? Why's he letting go, Cuno?"

links.title: Cuno: ""I don't know, baby," Cuno shrugs...."
links.text: "I don't know, baby," Cuno shrugs. "I don't know why he's such a f*g."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Officer, if I may ask -- what were..."
links.text: "Officer, if I may ask -- what were you trying to achieve by pulling on the deceased foot?"

links.title: You: "(Back off and look at the corpse.)"
links.text: (Back off and look at the corpse.)

links.title: The Hanged Man: "The cadaver slowly twists on the ca..."
links.text: The cadaver slowly twists on the cargo belt, his torso covered in tattoos and extremities blotched pink and blue.

dialogueTree.title: The Hanged Man: "The man before you is naked, but fo..."
dialogueTree.text: The man before you is naked, but for a pair of underpants and white boots. His skin is marbled with decaying veins and blotched by lividity. On his chest: a fading web of tattoos. The cargo belt used to hang him from the tree looks reinforced.

links.title: You: "Inspect the boots."
links.text: Inspect the boots.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "The material appears to be ceramic...."
links.text: The material appears to be ceramic. Its clean white stands in stark contrast to the decaying flesh above the knee. The man wore thick polymer socks, probably for padding. A fine array of interlocking plates covers them.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Delicate and fragile, they feel ali..."
links.text: Delicate and fragile, they feel alien to the world around you. Out of place somehow.

links.title: Logic: "These are clearly not boots, they'r..."
links.text: These are clearly not boots, they're *armour*. Possibly part of a larger set.

links.title: You: ""These aren't just boots, are they..."
links.text: "These aren't just boots, are they -- they're armour."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Indeed..." With his notebook under..."
links.text: "Indeed..." With his notebook under his arm the lieutenant crouches to inspect the soles: "Technically speaking these are *sabatons*, not boots."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Oh! The lieutenant uses a Mnemotech..."
links.text: Oh! The lieutenant uses a Mnemotechnique A6 -- that's not just any notebook, it's a classic!

links.title: You: "Forget about the notebook -- tell m..."
links.text: Forget about the notebook -- tell me about the armour!

links.title: Encyclopedia: "It's clearly some manner of super-a..."
links.text: It's clearly some manner of super-armour. Or future armour? Super-future armour? I'm useless.

links.title: You: "Thanks, super useful to know."
links.text: Thanks, super useful to know.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "It's all you, baby."
links.text: It's all you, baby.

links.title: You: ""What kind of armour is this exactl..."
links.text: "What kind of armour is this exactly?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ceramic plate. Zirconium dioxide m..."
links.text: "Ceramic plate. Zirconium dioxide most likely. This is where the make would be..."

links.title: You: ""Where?""
links.text: "Where?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Under the heel. Fairweather..." He..."
links.text: "Under the heel. Fairweather..." He turns the boot slightly. "Fairweather model T-500 / VE. I'm guessing that's 'vitreous enamel'. This is advanced stuff."

links.title: You: ""Okay then -- what kind of *armour*..."
links.text: "Okay then -- what kind of *armour* is this?"

links.title: You: ""What kind of boots are these?""
links.text: "What kind of boots are these?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""They're armour, not boots." With h..."
links.text: "They're armour, not boots." With his notebook under his arm the lieutenant crouches to inspect the soles: "Technically speaking these are *sabatons*."

links.title: You: "Back off."
links.text: Back off.

links.title: You: "Inspect the belt."
links.text: Inspect the belt.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "The hangman's knot is pulled tight..."
links.text: The hangman's knot is pulled tight by the weight of the corpse below. Yellow, hard-edged polyester cuts into his neck. Above, a sliding buckle ties the belt to the branch.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "This is a steel-reinforced cargo la..."
links.text: This is a steel-reinforced cargo lashing belt, big brother of the regular cargo belt. It's used for tying cargo under six-rotor airships.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Oh my, there's something on the bel..."
links.text: Oh my, there's something on the belt... a familiar word that speaks to the *thirst* within you.

links.title: You: "What was that? A word?"
links.text: What was that? A word?

links.title: The Hanged Man: "VERMILLION, in yellow letters along..."
links.text: VERMILLION, in yellow letters along the length of the twisting cargo belt. Only a deep longing for Vermillion *Golden Spirits* lets you decipher the fading logo of the local brewery.

links.title: You: ""I should get a drink.""
links.text: "I should get a drink."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No. You should *not* get a drink...."
links.text: "No. You should *not* get a drink. You should perform an initial inspection of the victim's corpse -- we're on the rope part."

links.title: You: ""This is a bad time for a drink, ri..."
links.text: "This is a bad time for a drink, right?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Extremely.""
links.text: "Extremely."

links.title: You: "Ignore it."
links.text: Ignore it.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "It's hard, but somehow you manage n..."
links.text: It's hard, but somehow you manage not to see it. The corpse looks at you sideways, from an unnatural angle.

links.title: You: ""What kind of rope is this?""
links.text: "What kind of rope is this?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Industrial strength. The kind used..."
links.text: "Industrial strength. The kind used for tying cargo to lorries."

links.title: Inland Empire: "Like in a circus! When the circus l..."
links.text: Like in a circus! When the circus leaves town and they tie a black spotted giraffe to the wall of a carry-pen!

links.title: You: ""Like in a harbour?""
links.text: "Like in a harbour?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes. It looks like they used whate..."
links.text: "Yes. It looks like they used whatever was on hand, paying no attention to not incriminating themselves."

links.title: You: ""Like in a circus, for transporting..."
links.text: "Like in a circus, for transporting black spotted giraffes?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Uhm..." He considers it: "No. More..."
links.text: "Uhm..." He considers it: "No. More like in a *harbour*. Like the one just east of here. I get the sense they used whatever was on hand, without paying much attention to not incriminating themselves."

links.title: You: ""In a... I can't come up with anyth..."
links.text: "In a... I can't come up with anything other than a harbour."

links.title: You: ""Don't ask me how I know -- but thi..."
links.text: "Don't ask me how I know -- but this is a lashing belt used for airlifting cargo."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Airlifting? I thought it was used..."
links.text: "Airlifting? I thought it was used on lorries -- for strapping cargo to them."

links.title: You: ""Apparently this is the reinforced..."
links.text: "Apparently this is the reinforced kind. For air transport. My brain tells me so."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He nods. "The local harbour uses si..."
links.text: He nods. "The local harbour uses six-rotors to shuffle containers around. I get the sense they used whatever was on hand, without paying much attention to not incriminating themselves."

links.title: You: ""By *they* do you mean the Hardie b..."
links.text: "By *they* do you mean the Hardie boys?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He nods. "Right now everything seem..."
links.text: He nods. "Right now everything seems to fit their confession."

links.title: You: ""We're assuming dockworkers from th..."
links.text: "We're assuming dockworkers from the harbour did it?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes." He agrees. "The debrief we g..."
links.text: "Yes." He agrees. "The debrief we got from the Wild Pines representative appears to be solid too. A lynching is what this looks like."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes." He agrees. "The debrief we g..."
links.text: "Yes." He agrees. "The debrief we got from the Wild Pines representative appears to be solid too. A lynching is what this looks like. Our internal RCM brief said the same..." He looks at you.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""By the way, when you get the chanc..."
links.text: "By the way, when you get the chance -- *perhaps* you should ask me to share the RCM brief you. I'm pretty sure you've *forgotten* it."

links.title: You: ""We're assuming dockworkers from th..."
links.text: "We're assuming dockworkers from the harbour did it?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm still approaching this as a ly..."
links.text: "I'm still approaching this as a lynching, yes. Motivated by the ongoing strike." He politely raises an eyebrow: "You?"

links.title: Inland Empire: "No. You *feel* like it was somethin..."
links.text: No. You *feel* like it was something else -- but what?

links.title: You: ""Makes sense. Believably mundane.""
links.text: "Makes sense. Believably mundane."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Seventy percent of the cases I get..."
links.text: "Seventy percent of the cases I get are just filling in the blanks on the initial report." He covers his nose. "This belt worries me."

links.title: You: ""I feel like it was something else.""
links.text: "I feel like it was something else."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes." He covers his nose. "It ofte..."
links.text: "Yes." He covers his nose. "It often is. This belt worries me."

links.title: You: ""Don't ask me, I'm just lumbering f..."
links.text: "Don't ask me, I'm just lumbering from one moment to the next."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We all are." He covers his nose. "..."
links.text: "We all are." He covers his nose. "This belt worries me."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The brief suggested as much. Polit..."
links.text: "The brief suggested as much. Politically motivated by the ongoing strike... did you not get a briefing?"

links.title: You: ""Uhm, yeah.""
links.text: "Uhm, yeah."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Then you should ask me the first m..."
links.text: "Then you should ask me the first moment we get."

links.title: You: ""No. They might have forgotten to b..."
links.text: "No. They might have forgotten to brief me."

links.title: You: ""My past has undergone total annihi..."
links.text: "My past has undergone total annihilation. Nothing remains -- my mother, the love of my life. Certainly not a *briefing*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay." He blinks. "You should ask..."
links.text: "Okay." He blinks. "You should ask me for one the first moment we get."

links.title: You: ""They sure wanted him to stay there..."
links.text: "They sure wanted him to stay there. The polyester seems strong."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I was afraid it would be..." He ri..."
links.text: "I was afraid it would be..." He rises to inspect the noose. "Thin steel wiring, parallel strands. This makes getting him down more problematic than I had assumed..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's not merely polyester -- it's..."
links.text: "It's not merely polyester -- it's steel reinforced." He rises to inspect the noose. "See these lines? This is where the wires run. I see rabbets for more than twenty strands."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This makes getting him down much m..."
links.text: "This makes getting him down much more problematic than I had assumed..."

links.title: You: ""How did they even get him up there?""
links.text: "How did they even get him up there?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A noose is one of those things tha..."
links.text: "A noose is one of those things that's easier to use one way around..." He points to the buckle tying the belt to the branch above.

links.title: You: ""Did they climb up using the kids'..."
links.text: "Did they climb up using the kids' ladder?" (Point to the one at the side of the tree.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That ladder can't carry a grown ma..."
links.text: "That ladder can't carry a grown man. I didn't see any splintering either, did you? I think they lassoed the branch, then pulled on the belt to close the buckle..." He makes a pulling motion.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I think they lassoed the branch, t..."
links.text: "I think they lassoed the branch, then pulled on the belt -- buckle closes." He makes a pulling motion. "It's what I would do. Seems easier than climbing up there."

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Could be. The shape of the branch s..."
links.text: Could be. The shape of the branch supports the theory.

links.title: You: "(Back off and look at the corpse.)"
links.text: (Back off and look at the corpse.)

links.title: The Hanged Man: "The cadaver hangs from the cargo be..."
links.text: The cadaver hangs from the cargo belt --limbs limp and torso covered in tattoos.

links.title: You: ""Then again what do I know? I don't..."
links.text: "Then again what do I know? I don't even know what an airship is!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No, you're right. The harbour uses..."
links.text: "No, you're right. The harbour uses six-rotors to shuffle containers around. They used whatever was on hand here. Without paying attention to not incriminating themselves."

links.title: You: "Inspect the tattoos."
links.text: Inspect the tattoos.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "An intricate web of blue lines stre..."
links.text: An intricate web of blue lines stretches across the torso. If you want to re-examine the tattoos, looking at the photo would give you a better, more detailed view.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "An intricate web of blue lines stre..."
links.text: An intricate web of blue lines stretches across the torso. From the right shoulder to the solar plexus, each time they intersect a small white star is formed in their crossing. Hundreds of fading asterisks riddle his skin, their concentration is highest around his heart.

links.title: Inland Empire: "His corpse is marked by stars."
links.text: His corpse is marked by stars.

links.title: You: "What will mine be marked by?"
links.text: What will mine be marked by?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Alcohol and heartbreak."
links.text: Alcohol and heartbreak.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Your fist clenches suddenly."
links.text: Your fist clenches suddenly.

links.title: You: "It will be marked by bullet holes."
links.text: It will be marked by bullet holes.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "Decay is creeping on the tattoo, al..."
links.text: Decay is creeping on the tattoo, already most of the canvas that's holding it has darkened, now it disintegrates slowly, letting out a stink...

links.title: You: "It will be riddled with disco."
links.text: It will be riddled with disco.

links.title: You: ""Is this a map of the night sky?""
links.text: "Is this a map of the night sky?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A map of the stars?" He turns arou..."
links.text: "A map of the stars?" He turns around to breathe before inspecting it closer. "I do see some similarity to astronomical charts, Great Century Messinian maybe... But this seems more particular. Customized somehow."

links.title: Conceptualization: "As if someone left out most of the..."
links.text: As if someone left out most of the night sky, filtering it through personal choice. The principle of this filter remains unknown to you. The thought dissipates and you feel as though you were only half-right.

links.title: You: ""I'm missing something here.""
links.text: "I'm missing something here."
"So am I." A sudden ringing fills the air as the lieutenant pulls down the zipper of his orange jacket.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "He wears a wide leather belt around..."
links.text: He wears a wide leather belt around his waist and a gun holster under his arm.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He takes a thin piece of milled alu..."
links.text: He takes a thin piece of milled aluminium from his coat pocket and pulls it open. Sounds like a sword being unsheathed. A small lens appears -- some sort of camera.

links.title: You: ""What's that?""
links.text: "What's that?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A Trigat Sunshine. Mini.""
links.text: "A Trigat Sunshine. Mini."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Trigat is the world's leading manuf..."
links.text: Trigat is the world's leading manufacturer of intercommunication devices, primarily projectors. The camera before you looks familiar somehow.

links.title: You: "Let the lieutenant work."
links.text: Let the lieutenant work.

links.title: Cunoesse: ""Shit, Cuno! WHAT THE FUCK IS THAT?..."
links.text: "Shit, Cuno! WHAT THE FUCK IS THAT?!?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""An instant colour camera." He prod..."
links.text: "An instant colour camera." He produces two metal-capped ampoules and clicks them into place on the side of the apparatus. A thin slot shines there...

links.title: Suggestion: "This is the first time he openly ac..."
links.text: This is the first time he openly acknowledges the kids' existence.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I have only two ampoules, so nobod..."
links.text: "I have only two ampoules, so nobody move -- I don't want to waste one." He points the camera at the corpse, peering into it. The lens needs adjusting. Then:

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "A sound, a shrill flash. Followed b..."
links.text: A sound, a shrill flash. Followed by the breaking of a small ampoule of glass. You see streams of colour pour onto the thick, glossy piece of paper rolling out.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""In case we need it," the lieutenan..."
links.text: "In case we need it," the lieutenant says and shakes the paper, letting it dry in the cold wind. On it -- a colour-perfect copy of the dead man's tattooed chest.

links.title: You: ""Cool machine.""
links.text: "Cool machine."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes..." He slides the camera close..."
links.text: "Yes..." He slides the camera closed and tucks it away on his belt. "It is pretty *cool*, isn't it?"

links.title: Interfacing: "There is only one ampoule left. Use..."
links.text: There is only one ampoule left. Use it wisely.

links.title: You: ""What do we need this photo for?""
links.text: "What do we need this photo for?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It contains insight to the victim'..."
links.text: "It contains insight to the victim's person. By his build, I'd say this was a man of physical violence. The story he wanted his body to tell was important to him. It is his letter -- to us. *Someone* should decipher it. We'll need to show it around."

links.title: You: ""Can I have it? I should look at it..."
links.text: "Can I have it? I should look at it later, without the corpse smell."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Sure, just don't lose it." He hand..."
links.text: "Sure, just don't lose it." He hands you the piece of rolled up photo paper. It's no larger than a pack of cigarettes.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "The glassy-eyed corpse looks by, hi..."
links.text: The glassy-eyed corpse looks by, his mouth mute and his skin as colourful as the chemical rainbow on the photo paper, teeming with opportunistic organisms.

links.title: Tutorial Agent: "You've acquired an interactable ite..."
links.text: You've acquired an interactable item. Investigate this item further by going to the INTERACT tab in your INVENTORY.

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Here -- a souvenir." He hands you..."
links.text: "Here -- a souvenir." He hands you the piece of rolled up photo paper. It's no larger than a pack of cigarettes. "Don't lose it."

links.title: You: ""We're missing something here.""
links.text: "We're missing something here."
"I agree." A sudden ring fills the air as the lieutenant pulls down the zipper of his orange jacket.

links.title: You: ""Is this a micro-electronic system?""
links.text: "Is this a micro-electronic system?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I have only a cursive knowledge of..."
links.text: "I have only a cursive knowledge of the science of cybernetics -- I would not know if it were. But it's not *quite* complex enough, is it?"

links.title: Interfacing: "It doesn't seem familiar from the i..."
links.text: It doesn't seem familiar from the insides of any radiocomputer your mind can imagine. The somewhat organic lines remind you of old filament memory units, but not quite? No. You're nowhere near right.

links.title: You: ""Is this a national pattern?""
links.text: "Is this a national pattern?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Of no nation that I know of. If an..."
links.text: "Of no nation that I know of. If anything, it reminds me of religious illumination, last or penultimate century. Men who live harsh lives often turn to innocentic worship -- but which one? I see no trace of a humanoid figure."

links.title: Half Light: "The pattern does not stir patriotic..."
links.text: The pattern does not stir patriotic or religious sentiment in you. What it does is speak to the wounded, limping animal -- the male in particular. Unable to communicate in anything more than grunts, it's impossible to tell if it's advice is right or wrong...

links.title: You: "Look him in the eye."
links.text: Look him in the eye.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "His eyes are milky white and blind..."
links.text: His eyes are milky white and blind to the world, protruding comically from their sockets. There is no one home, just sub-aquatic terrors there.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "These eyes used to be blue. Baby bl..."
links.text: These eyes used to be blue. Baby blue.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "Dark brown hair grows on his head,..."
links.text: Dark brown hair grows on his head, his face is ready to explode from the organic processes inside. The death's head grin has passed, what remains is an unrecognisable mess.

links.title: Empathy: "Underneath the curdled meat there i..."
links.text: Underneath the curdled meat there is an expression, not carried on his features but below, inside: an expression of pleasure. This man was experiencing *joy* at the moment of his death.

links.title: You: ""This man enjoyed the moment of dea..."
links.text: "This man enjoyed the moment of death."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Why do you think so?""
links.text: "Why do you think so?"

links.title: You: ""I don't know.""
links.text: "I don't know."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hmm..." The lieutenant marks somet..."
links.text: "Hmm..." The lieutenant marks something in his notebook.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "I am less sceptic about this hunch,..."
links.text: I am less sceptic about this hunch, he thinks, than I was of the supra-natural premonitions that overtook you at the trash container. He then covers his nose again...

links.title: You: ""It's an intuition.""
links.text: "It's an intuition."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay." The lieutenant marks someth..."
links.text: "Okay." The lieutenant marks something in his notebook.

links.title: You: ""For supra-natural reasons.""
links.text: "For supra-natural reasons."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There are no supra-natural reasons..."
links.text: "There are no supra-natural reasons," the lieutenant says, marking something in his notebook.

links.title: You: ""His eyes, they used to be blue.""
links.text: "His eyes, they used to be blue."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good. The victim is of Occidental..."
links.text: "Good. The victim is of Occidental descent," he scribbles in his notebook. "Light brown hair -- blue eyes."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "When he says Occidental he means wh..."
links.text: When he says Occidental he means white. Originally from the Occidental sub-continent on Mundi.

links.title: You: ""Occidental?""
links.text: "Occidental?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I mean white.""
links.text: "I mean white."

links.title: You: ""Tell me, who are you, dead man?""
links.text: "Tell me, who are you, dead man?"

links.title: Inland Empire: "The corpse is dead silent. You have..."
links.text: The corpse is dead silent. You have no idea why you just said that.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Who is he? He is male, forty to fi..."
links.text: "Who is he? He is male, forty to fifty. With an athletic build."

links.title: You: "(Back off.)"
links.text: (Back off.)

links.title: The Hanged Man: "The corpse looks right through you..."
links.text: The corpse looks right through you as you distance yourself from its stench, eyes like a shark...

links.title: You: "Squint and take a step back."
links.text: Squint and take a step back.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "As you narrow your eyes, the monste..."
links.text: As you narrow your eyes, the monster before you blurs into a violent mess of green and pink.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "This is a trick. You've done it bef..."
links.text: This is a trick. You've done it before. Pink is where the blood settled in the first hours postmortem. You can use it to see if the corpse has been tampered with -- does his position at the time of death match the discolouration?

links.title: You: "Observe."
links.text: Observe.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "Only the lower extremities are pink..."
links.text: Only the lower extremities are pink with a dash of blue: his fatted hands, thighs and his neck, just above the noose. The rest of the corpse appears dark green in the cold spring air.

links.title: You: ""His face and hands are pink. Thigh..."
links.text: "His face and hands are pink. Thighs too."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I see it." He adjusts his glasses...."
links.text: "I see it." He adjusts his glasses. "His neck too, the lividity goes right up his chin. We have good, well-pronounced discolouration here..."

links.title: You: "Relax your eyes."
links.text: Relax your eyes.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "The monster comes back into focus:..."
links.text: The monster comes back into focus: an explosion of colour, coursing with dark marbled veins. His stomach appears pregnant with something -- black liquid streams down his thigh and onto his boot.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""So -- what do you think?""
links.text: "So -- what do you think?"

links.title: Half Light: "*I* think he's dead -- and about to..."
links.text: *I* think he's dead -- and about to explode.

links.title: You: ""I think he's dead.""
links.text: "I think he's dead."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I agree.""
links.text: "I agree."

links.title: Suggestion: "There are crows feet in his eyes, h..."
links.text: There are crows feet in his eyes, he's laughing silently.

links.title: Conceptualization: "His personality is no longer a part..."
links.text: His personality is no longer a part of the world.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Totally dead.""
links.text: "Totally dead."

links.title: You: ""The world no longer stores his per..."
links.text: "The world no longer stores his personality in its composition. There was a time for that -- and it ended seven days ago."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He nods in agreement with this adva..."
links.text: He nods in agreement with this advanced piece of conceptualization. Having mulled it over the lieutenant says: "That sounds about right, yes."

links.title: You: "No, better not to say that. Too hea..."
links.text: No, better not to say that. Too heavy.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "Sure. The corpse looks by, obliviou..."
links.text: Sure. The corpse looks by, oblivious. Black decay liquid drops from his knee to his boot.

links.title: You: ""Totally.""
links.text: "Totally."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Absolutely.""
links.text: "Absolutely."

links.title: You: ""This buster's not coming back.""
links.text: "This buster's not coming back."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No sirree." He shakes his head."
links.text: "No sirree." He shakes his head.

links.title: You: ""Deadady-dead-dead-dead.""
links.text: "Deadady-dead-dead-dead."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Daba-doop-doop-dead," he says with..."
links.text: "Daba-doop-doop-dead," he says without a hint of melody. Not one muscle in his face moves.

links.title: You: ""What is *dead* anyway?""
links.text: "What is *dead* anyway?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""He is." He points to the corpse."
links.text: "He is." He points to the corpse.

links.title: You: ""I think he was upright after death..."
links.text: "I think he was upright after death. His hands, feet and neck are discoloured."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Agreed." He points to the belt. "E..."
links.text: "Agreed." He points to the belt. "Especially on the neck. The belt acted like a tourniquet keeping the blood in his head. The hypostasis supports a hanging."

links.title: Visual Calculus: "You would still like the hypostasis..."
links.text: You would still like the hypostasis marks in the neck to be a *bit* more pronounced.

links.title: You: ""For some reason my brain would lik..."
links.text: "For some reason my brain would like the pink to be more pronounced, especially in the neck."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Maybe it looks faint to you?" He l..."
links.text: "Maybe it looks faint to you?" He leans closer, covering his nose: "It *could* be more pronounced, actually. Dûment noté."

links.title: You: ""Yup. Seems like a lynching to me.""
links.text: "Yup. Seems like a lynching to me."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Everything here seems to corrobora..."
links.text: "Everything here seems to corroborate that assumption. But we should still get him *down* before assigning a probable cause of death."

links.title: You: ""Could it still be he was moved aft..."
links.text: "Could it still be he was moved after death?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There's always a chance. We should..."
links.text: "There's always a chance. We should check for ligament marks on his neck to see if they're in tune with the belt. We'll have to get him *down* first..."

links.title: You: ""Maybe he was strangled by someone?""
links.text: "Maybe he was strangled by someone?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, there's always a chance we're..."
links.text: "Yes, there's always a chance we're wrong. We should check for ligament marks on his neck to see if they're in tune with the belt. We'll have to get him *down* first..."

links.title: You: ""I don't know what to think. What d..."
links.text: "I don't know what to think. What do you think?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I think he was upright immediately..."
links.text: "I think he was upright immediately after death. Blood has gathered in his hands and feet. And his neck." He points to his fattened chin.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The noose acted like a tourniquet,..."
links.text: "The noose acted like a tourniquet, keeping the blood in his head. The hypostasis here is in tune with a hanging. That's what I think."

links.title: You: ""We know he wasn't hung, so I'd say..."
links.text: "We know he wasn't hung, so I'd say he was treated. These markings were produced."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""To purposefully mislead us." He no..."
links.text: "To purposefully mislead us." He nods. "They must've hung him fast after that bullet hit. This is well done. It would have fooled *me*."

links.title: You: "(Cover your nose.) "Something is co..."
links.text: (Cover your nose.) "Something is coming out of him."

links.title: The Hanged Man: "A pool of blood and faeces has eate..."
links.text: A pool of blood and faeces has eaten into the frozen mud below the man's feet. Purge liquid is dripping into it, drop by drop.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The victim appears to have contain..."
links.text: "The victim appears to have contained no more than half a kilogram of digestion at the time of death."

links.title: Cuno: ""The fuck he sayin'?""
links.text: "The fuck he sayin'?"

links.title: Cunoesse: ""F****ts talkin' 'bout shit.""
links.text: "F****ts talkin' 'bout shit."

links.title: You: ""We got lucky.""
links.text: "We got lucky."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Did we? I don't *feel* lucky.""
links.text: "Did we? I don't *feel* lucky."

links.title: You: ""Maybe he went to the toilet some t..."
links.text: "Maybe he went to the toilet some time before death?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Maybe." He doesn't *really* want t..."
links.text: "Maybe." He doesn't *really* want to dwell on it too long.

links.title: You: ""God damn right I'm a f****t!" (Tur..."
links.text: "God damn right I'm a f****t!" (Turn around and yell.)

links.title: Cunoesse: "Malicious laughter erupts in the ya..."
links.text: Malicious laughter erupts in the yard. Sounds like seagulls.

links.title: Cuno: ""Pig said he's a f****t.""
links.text: "Pig said he's a f****t."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant's face is made of st..."
links.text: The lieutenant's face is made of stone.

links.title: You: ""Should we worry? His stomach looks..."
links.text: "Should we worry? His stomach looks like it's gonna explode."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There's a..." his eye twitches for..."
links.text: "There's a..." his eye twitches for a moment, "a strong build-up of gases, yes. Rigor mortis becoming livor mortis. He'll be fully limp by tomorrow. I don't think he'll explode... I *hope* not."

links.title: Visual Calculus: "For seven days the cadaver is quite..."
links.text: For seven days the cadaver is quite well preserved. Surprisingly so -- there's no deflation, no apparent fly larvae in the abdomen.

links.title: You: ""For a week he seems *well* preserv..."
links.text: "For a week he seems *well* preserved actually."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""As I said it's been below freezing..."
links.text: "As I said it's been below freezing since last Sunday. Today is the first chance to thaw. Things would be... *worse* if it had thawed earlier."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I've kept an eye on the forecast...."
links.text: "I've kept an eye on the forecast. It's been below freezing since last Sunday. Today is the first chance to thaw. Things would be... *worse* if it had thawed earlier."

links.title: You: "Keep it to yourself."
links.text: Keep it to yourself.

links.title: The Hanged Man: "Good. Death does not care for your..."
links.text: Good. Death does not care for your smart alecking. It reeks and disintegrates in a feast for cadaverine bacteria.

links.title: You: ""He's beaten up -- see the bruises?""
links.text: "He's beaten up -- see the bruises?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I do. Most of them are postmortem...."
links.text: "I do. Most of them are postmortem. Maybe even all of them. The delinquents have made our jobs harder with their little sport."

links.title: Cuno: ""Stop talking in riddles, coin slot.""
links.text: "Stop talking in riddles, coin slot."

links.title: Cunoesse: ""He means you fucked him up good, C..."
links.text: "He means you fucked him up good, Cuno," the girl yells. "Fucked him up brutal-like."

links.title: You: "(Back off and catch your breath.)"
links.text: (Back off and catch your breath.)

links.title: The Hanged Man: "But there is no breath to catch --..."
links.text: But there is no breath to catch -- only the cadaver filling the air and your nostrils. He slowly rotates before you, decomposing.

links.title: You: ""I'm squinting, Kim. Why am I doing..."
links.text: "I'm squinting, Kim. Why am I doing it?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""How should I know why you're squin..."
links.text: "How should I know why you're squinting, officer?"

links.title: You: "(Squint harder) "His face and hands..."
links.text: (Squint harder) "His face and hands are pink. Thighs too. The rest is greenish."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Oh," he snorts. "You're trying to..."
links.text: "Oh," he snorts. "You're trying to assess *lividity*."

links.title: You: "(Stop squinting) "I don't know eith..."
links.text: (Stop squinting) "I don't know either. Maybe I should just stop."

links.title: You: "Stop, relax your eyes."
links.text: Stop, relax your eyes.

links.title: You: ""So, how do we get him down?""
links.text: "So, how do we get him down?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We should have a look at that belt..."
links.text: "We should have a look at that belt before we even *consider* taking him down. It looks worrisome." (He points to the belt around his neck.)

links.title: You: ""We've looked at the belt, now how..."
links.text: "We've looked at the belt, now how do we get him down?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Are you sure we've finished the pr..."
links.text: "Are you sure we've finished the preliminary examination of the cadaver? We might miss some of these things once he's down." He stops to think, then checks his notes.

links.title: You: "Step back and have another look fir..."
links.text: Step back and have another look first.

links.title: You: ""We've been thorough. Do you have a..."
links.text: "We've been thorough. Do you have a plan for getting him down?" (Proceed.)

links.title: You: ""Yup. The preliminary examination i..."
links.text: "Yup. The preliminary examination is done -- let's get him down from there."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hmh... The steel-reinforced belt p..."
links.text: "Hmh... The steel-reinforced belt presents a *unique* challenge. I brought chain-cutters, but I don't see a good angle of approach to the belt."

links.title: Rhetoric: "He doesn't actually think the chall..."
links.text: He doesn't actually think the challenge is *unique*. He thinks it's frustrating, annoying and harder than he thought.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The cadaver is a good 1.2 metres u..."
links.text: "The cadaver is a good 1.2 metres up, neither one of us can reach the belt without assistance. And even if we do, there's the question of cutting the airship-strength material..."

links.title: Physical Instrument: "There's no *question*. There's only..."
links.text: There's no *question*. There's only CUTTING. How hard can it be?

links.title: Savoir Faire: "An acrobatic manoeuvre would solve..."
links.text: An acrobatic manoeuvre would solve this situation. Nothing can go wrong with a good *manoeuvre*.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The cadaver is a good 1.2 metres u..."
links.text: "The cadaver is a good 1.2 metres up, neither one of us can reach the belt without assistance. And even if we do, there's the question of cutting it..."

links.title: You: ""We need to talk about getting him..."
links.text: "We need to talk about getting him down again."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, we do." The lieutenant inspec..."
links.text: "Yes, we do." The lieutenant inspects the belt, his forehead is lined with worry.

links.title: You: ""Can't someone else do it?""
links.text: "Can't someone else do it?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Someone else?" He pauses. "You mea..."
links.text: "Someone else?" He pauses. "You mean like... *the police*?"

links.title: Rhetoric: "What was that about *Processing*, t..."
links.text: What was that about *Processing*, then -- weren't they supposed to take care of the *boots*? Why don't they help?

links.title: You: ""Yes, exactly -- call the police.""
links.text: "Yes, exactly -- call the police."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Someone already did. You know who..."
links.text: "Someone already did. You know who came? We did. Because we have made bad life decisions."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I know it's hard. But I assure you..."
links.text: "I know it's hard. But I assure you -- the others won't come to help us. And we have a *growing* sanitary concern here. We need to get him down, fast."

links.title: You: ""Can't the boys from Processing tak..."
links.text: "Can't the boys from Processing take care of this?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No.""
links.text: "No."

links.title: You: ""Why?""
links.text: "Why?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Think of the *boys from Processing..."
links.text: "Think of the *boys from Processing* as murderers. Only instead of people they murder crime scenes. Processing is a wrecking crew. They know how to commission off items and how to work the incinerator in the morgue."

links.title: You: ""Okay then.""
links.text: "Okay then."

links.title: You: ""You have a point there.""
links.text: "You have a point there."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Sadly, yes. The whole RCM is out t..."
links.text: "Sadly, yes. The whole RCM is out there right now, doing the exact same thing we are. Are we in a rush to help them? Not with this on our hands..." He covers his nose.

links.title: You: ""I mean someone who's *below* detec..."
links.text: "I mean someone who's *below* detective."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Someone like a paid garbage man? O..."
links.text: "Someone like a paid garbage man? Or a cleaning crew? I have bad news for you -- that *is* a detective."

links.title: You: ""I can cut the belt easily. Where a..."
links.text: "I can cut the belt easily. Where are those chaincutters you mentioned?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't doubt your physical prowes..."
links.text: "I don't doubt your physical prowess, officer, but this is a gruelling surgical procedure. I saw twenty steel strands in there -- and we do not have a secure platform for the cutting."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The risk of... acrobatic failure i..."
links.text: "The risk of... acrobatic failure is one we cannot take. We must not become *comedy* for the locals."

links.title: Cuno: ""The fuck have you got against come..."
links.text: "The fuck have you got against comedy, pigs?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't doubt your physical prowes..."
links.text: "I don't doubt your physical prowess, officer, but that's aircraft strength material. And we do not have a secure platform to perform the procedure on."

links.title: You: ""We could bring your motor carriage..."
links.text: "We could bring your motor carriage over -- cut the belt from the roof?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I have thought of that, yes. But t..."
links.text: "I have thought of that, yes. But the tyre tracks would compromise the scene. Any prints would become illegible. That's *if* we get it through the hole in the fence..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Also, my MC has a sloped roof, it'..."
links.text: "Also, my MC has a sloped roof, it's a *sports* model." He makes a gesture indicating a harsh degree of sloping. "The roof is slippery -- an all-around bad platform to stand on."

links.title: Empathy: "He could come up with at least four..."
links.text: He could come up with at least four more reasons why not to trample on the roof of his *sports model* motor carriage.

links.title: You: ""Could your attachment to your spor..."
links.text: "Could your attachment to your sports model motor carriage be clouding your judgement?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes," he concedes. "I am attached..."
links.text: "Yes," he concedes. "I am attached to it. But it's also unsuitable. We can't bring a supercharged tractor through that tiny gap in the fence, then plough the scene with it. Then fall off the roof. It would sound bad on Channel 8."

links.title: Cunoesse: ""It'd sound fucking hilarious, do i..."
links.text: "It'd sound fucking hilarious, do it! Fucking get on top of it and dance, fägäri!"

links.title: You: ""How about I take you piggyback?""
links.text: "How about I take you piggyback?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""How about I take *you* piggyback?"..."
links.text: "How about I take *you* piggyback?" After a moment’s silence, he raises an eyebrow.

links.title: Cuno: ""The fuck are these pigs talking ab..."
links.text: "The fuck are these pigs talking about?"

links.title: Cunoesse: ""Their bank or something. It's fuck..."
links.text: "Their bank or something. It's fucking boring, Cuno. Wish they'd fuck already."

links.title: You: ""Fucking SHUT UP!""
links.text: "Fucking SHUT UP!"

links.title: Cuno: ""Pig, why you gotta disrespect my g..."
links.text: "Pig, why you gotta disrespect my girl? This shit makes Cuno *sad*."

links.title: Cunoesse: ""Fuck that *banaanipoika* in the as..."
links.text: "Fuck that *banaanipoika* in the ass Cuno!"

links.title: You: ""Would you please shut up.""
links.text: "Would you please shut up."

links.title: Cunoesse: ""Would you please SUCK MY DICK?" Th..."
links.text: "Would you please SUCK MY DICK?" The one behind the fence makes a gesture, as if taking out their penis.

links.title: Cunoesse: ""Fucking *mulkku*...""
links.text: "Fucking *mulkku*..."

links.title: You: ""Lieutenant, are you sure you could..."
links.text: "Lieutenant, are you sure you could carry my weight though?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I wasn't actually implying I would..."
links.text: "I wasn't actually implying I would. I meant it's a bad idea."

links.title: Cunoesse: ""It's a fucking hilarious idea -- y..."
links.text: "It's a fucking hilarious idea -- you two paskapää's get on top each other and *fuck*!"

links.title: Composure: "In silence, the lieutenant gives yo..."
links.text: In silence, the lieutenant gives you a meaningful glance. As if to say: *case in point*.

links.title: You: ""Lieutenant, you meant it rhetorica..."
links.text: "Lieutenant, you meant it rhetorically, right? You're criticizing my idea?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes. It's not a good idea.""
links.text: "Yes. It's not a good idea."

links.title: You: "(Give up.) "Okay, how about...""
links.text: (Give up.) "Okay, how about..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant inspects the belt, h..."
links.text: The lieutenant inspects the belt, his forehead lined with worry.

links.title: You: ""We could saw the branch.""
links.text: "We could saw the branch."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Climb up there and... saw the bran..."
links.text: "Climb up there and... saw the branch?"

links.title: Savoir Faire: "It *seems* unclimbable, cause the l..."
links.text: It *seems* unclimbable, cause the ladder is treacherously rotten, but you could use your hands and feet to reach around the tree, then hang from the branch...

links.title: You: ""I could do it. It's well within my..."
links.text: "I could do it. It's well within my repertoire."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Honestly, I prefer a *non-acrobati..."
links.text: "Honestly, I prefer a *non-acrobatic* solution to this." He looks around -- then at you.

links.title: You: ""Why?""
links.text: "Why?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""*Clown Cops Climb Tree, Fall Down*..."
links.text: "*Clown Cops Climb Tree, Fall Down*," he says, furrowing his brow. "*Enraged Cop Assaults Children -- After Falling From Tree*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""*Cretin Cop*... -- they like that..."
links.text: "*Cretin Cop*... -- they like that word -- ...*Saws The Branch He's Sitting On (Literally)*. *Local Children Report Corpse Mutilation*."

links.title: Cunoesse: ""Fuck, yeah! Climb that shit, monke..."
links.text: "Fuck, yeah! Climb that shit, monkeys!"

links.title: Cuno: ""C, you're only making them do thos..."
links.text: "C, you're only making them do those things less."

links.title: You: ""Can you see into the future, Kim?""
links.text: "Can you see into the future, Kim?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No, I do not see the future. I mad..."
links.text: "No, I do not see the future. I made those up using two decades in the Revacholian police force as a reference point."

links.title: You: ""I'm not afraid of newspapers. We s..."
links.text: "I'm not afraid of newspapers. We shouldn't be."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Oh, no." He shakes his head slowly..."
links.text: "Oh, no." He shakes his head slowly. "We should be *very* afraid of newspapers. And the radio stations too. We should be wary of enticing them in *any* way."

links.title: Authority: "This is years of experience talking..."
links.text: This is years of experience talking. He's seen career after career ruined by careless media strategies.

links.title: You: ""So we're going to just let those k..."
links.text: "So we're going to just let those kids bully us into not doing our work?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What I'm proposing is -- we save a..."
links.text: "What I'm proposing is -- we save acrobatic tricks as a last resort. After we've tried *everything* else."

links.title: Cunoesse: ""These have got to be the most fuck..."
links.text: "These have got to be the most fucking boring *mulkkupäät* I've ever seen."

links.title: You: ""You're right. The risks are too hi..."
links.text: "You're right. The risks are too high and there are too many."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes. We should use acrobatics as t..."
links.text: "Yes. We should use acrobatics as the very last option. After we've tried *everything* normal."

links.title: You: ""Yes. Either one of us could do it...."
links.text: "Yes. Either one of us could do it. We could use the kids' ladder on the side of the tree."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No," he says, shaking his head, "t..."
links.text: "No," he says, shaking his head, "that ladder is not climbable and I don't really see another good way up there."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't trust that ladder. The ass..."
links.text: "I don't trust that ladder. The assailants didn't use it. It's rotten and less sturdy than it looks. And I don't see another good way up there."

links.title: You: ""Yeah... it seems dangerous.""
links.text: "Yeah... it seems dangerous."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There has to be a less risky way...."
links.text: "There has to be a less risky way. With less falling down off trees."

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Even Cuno thinks it's unclimbable,..."
links.text: Even Cuno thinks it's unclimbable, cause the ladder is treacherously rotten, but you could use your hands and feet to reach around the tree, then hang from the branch...

links.title: Savoir Faire: "It seems doable. The kids' ladder i..."
links.text: It seems doable. The kids' ladder is treacherously rotten, but you could use your hands and feet to reach around the tree, then hang from the branch...

links.title: You: ""Seems like a lot of hassle, let's..."
links.text: "Seems like a lot of hassle, let's *not* do it."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We're *not* getting him down alrea..."
links.text: "We're *not* getting him down already. Not getting him down is a task that's already accomplished. Sadly, it's not our job to *keep* him up there, but to get him down."

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Just pull his rotting head off. The..."
links.text: Just pull his rotting head off. The meat's cooked anyway, give the boot another yank and it's done.

links.title: You: ""Let's just pull his head off.""
links.text: "Let's just pull his head off."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's tempting. But decapitating hi..."
links.text: "It's tempting. But decapitating him *might* be against regulations."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's tempting. But decapitating hi..."
links.text: "It's tempting. But decapitating him will make it impossible to ascertain whether he was really hung. The damage to the neck would make coronary work pointless."

links.title: You: "I don't really want to pull his hea..."
links.text: I don't really want to pull his head off.

links.title: Half Light: "How do you plan to get him down the..."
links.text: How do you plan to get him down then? With social sensibility? Are you going to *educate* him down?

links.title: You: ""Maybe we could *shoot* him down?""
links.text: "Maybe we could *shoot* him down?"

links.title: Cunoesse: ""Yeah!" The enthusiasm is unrestrai..."
links.text: "Yeah!" The enthusiasm is unrestrained. "Bang bang time, pigs! Shoot his head off!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant remains unaffected...."
links.text: The lieutenant remains unaffected. "How?"

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Where the buckle ties the rope to t..."
links.text: Where the buckle ties the rope to the branch -- that's a good spot to aim.
